---
title: "Learning German al la Zipf"
output: github_document
---

```{bash}
#!/bin/bash

find data/t* -name *.srt -print0 |
xargs -0 cat |
grep -v '^[0-9]' |
gsed 's/[?!.|]/ /g' |
gsed 's/ * / /g' |
gsed "s/[^A-Za-z\' ]//g" |
gsed 's/^ //g' |
gsed 's/ /\n/g' |
gsed '/^$/d' |
gsed -e 's/\(.*\)/\L\1/' |
LC_ALL='C' sort |
LC_ALL='C' uniq -c |
LC_ALL='C' sort -rn |
gsed -e 's/^[ \t]*//;s/ /,/' > all_data.csv

cat all_data.csv |head -1000 > 1000.csv
